website_summaries.verdict: Thin PVC fabric boots that don't cost much but keep your feet nicely dry.
pros: Flexible PVC material allows you to bend your ankle and leg comfortably
Extremely low price point for rain boots that will keep you dry up to the knees
Good tread to help you maintain your balance in slippery, wet conditions
cons: Thin materials won't stand up to rough treatment without damage

customer_reviews.title: The FAQs answer said these are made in USA, However product is stamped Made in China
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to buy American whenever possible, I researched these and was confident that they are made in the USA, but when I got them, they were stamped Made in China, VERY DECEPTIVE MARKETING, I of course sent them right back, the order was for CLC Custom Leathercraft R23010 Over The Sock Black PVC Men's Rain Boot, Size 10 Sold by: Amazon.com Services LLC,
customer_reviews.author: Debra Dillon

customer_reviews.title: VERY HAPPY WITH THIS PURCHASE!!
customer_reviews.text: VERY HAPPY WITH THIS PURCHASE! I use these for my pressure washing business & they are IDEAL. Heavy-duty & lightweight all-in-one.. and they couldn't be more comfortable. I virtually wear them 4-6 hours at the time & they keep me dry & wear good both with and without socks. When I'm doing jobs that I can wear my jeans, the jean legs easily tuck down into the boot, very well. And when I'm doing jobs that require my rubber suit for pressure washing, they overlap outside the boot nicely also. Great quality at a tremendous value.. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: GraphFX Creations

customer_reviews.title: Not made in the US
customer_reviews.text: Wow, not what was pictured at all. These boots have a button decoration on the wrong sides of the boots, there is no cotton lining, just plain rubber. the shaft is to small to allow pants to be tucked in. Everything about this boot is just wrong. Highly disappointed to have been so mislead by the description of this product. Junk !!
customer_reviews.author: Foo Foo

customer_reviews.title: Great yard boot and amazing value.
customer_reviews.text: Great for yard work. I’m a lady with a size 9 foot I purchased this men’s Wellies in an 8,5. Perfect! Wore them all day yesterday planting, walking in mud, over rocks, wet concrete, and regular ground with no issues. I had a thick sock on underneath and easily slipped my foot in and out of the boot. This was not a tight fit for me but not so loose that it was unsteady. Was just what I was looking for and what a great price.
customer_reviews.author: jk

customer_reviews.title: Not consistent ... and smell like a chemical factory!
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally purchased the size 14 boots, which were well made, had an insole, and were odorless. Since they were the wrong size, I returned them for the size 10 boots. These unfortunately were categorically the opposite. I do not know if these are counterfeit or what, but the quality is FAR different and they feel paper thin. Also, there is no insole, just a completely flat rubber feel. Lastly, the size 10 boots smell like a chemical factory! I cannot believe how different these boots are just by buying a different size. I suggest paying a few extra bucks and trying your luck elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed with these boots. I bought a pair of these in 2-11-2018 and they were great boots made in the U.S.A. for $19.08, they stand up on there own and fit well. These new boots made in China are cheap and fall over and are two sizes to big, yet I ordered the same size. These cost $24.14. I do not understand why when you reorder the same product you get something entirely different.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: These are great work rain boots
customer_reviews.text: These are great work rain boots. I am a construction electrician working on a new ground up project building a fairly large high school. We are in the underground and slab work phase so when it rains our floor turns from dirt to mud and water pits. I have stepped into puddles half way up my shin and my feet don't so much as dampen. They have thick strong soles that make walking through the mud easier and safer. Well made rubber boots. I dropped a hammer on one and barely felt it on my foot. Very impressed with these boots. Well worth the reasonable price
customer_reviews.author: Straw Hat

customer_reviews.title: RECEIVED AUGUST 17 AND IN GARBAGE NOVEMBER 1
customer_reviews.text: I walk my dog twice a day in a field. I wear the boots 30 minutes to an hour a day and between 1-2 miles. I did not wear these boots in August, hot and dry so the actual wear is less than it appears. Today I noticed a huge tear in the crease of the toe. I just want a boot that will last a season or two. Is that too much to ask?
customer_reviews.author: bronco pete

customer_reviews.title: Boots leak...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in the fall of 2016, only wore a few times, due to not enough severe rain. Last week or so, been wearing them a lot, less than 10 times in total. Noticed that they boots have a tiny leak in the toes, like right on the toe front surface. It's not enough that water is pouring in, but you notice it after about 10 minutes of walking. Its well past the return date, but I would return them if I could. Stay away from these.. they are not good enough for even casual city walking.
customer_reviews.author: steve mcnay

customer_reviews.title: Boots I received were too big and made in China
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers said these boots run small and that they are made in the US. I ordered a 10 when I am a 9.5-10. They fit like an 11. Mine were also made in China, which isn’t surprising considering the price. Maybe they used to be made in the US, but aren’t anymore. I might order a smaller pair, since they otherwise seem sturdy enough for how I plan to use them, working in my muddy yard for an hour or two at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L

customer_reviews.title: WELL WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my adult son who needed something for his landscaping business. At times, he is required to go into shallow bodies of water. In this case, he wore these boots in a stream to move rocks. He stated they are extremely comfortable and the traction is very good, as he didn't slip at all while walking in the water. Furthermore, he stated his feet were kept dry. Compared to other rain boots, he states these were WELL WORTH THE MONEY! Thank you for a great product at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These seem to run big so I could have probably ordered a 5 and it fit just fine (for this year
customer_reviews.text: I got a size 7 because they were out of 6 for my 91/2 year old son. He wears a size 5 1/2 but I thought maybe it would work. These seem to run big so I could have probably ordered a 5 and it fit just fine (for this year?). He actually asked if I would keep them for when he could wear them. When he is able to wear them, i'm sure the will hold up just fine. The shaft of the boot is a bit more thin and flexible, while the shoe seems thick and will keep his feet dry and warm.
customer_reviews.author: ROCHELLE L.

customer_reviews.title: Not Servus brand! I received a China made cheap boot
customer_reviews.text: I did NOT receive Servus brand boot I received CLC brand boot Made in China not USA Boots are not even same in construction They have no inner felt lining Just cheap pvc boot Do not buy this because you will not receive the boot in the description/photo
customer_reviews.author: GreenGirl

customer_reviews.title: CLC Branded Boot not a Servus Comfort Technology...
customer_reviews.text: Completely incorrect item from advertised. The pair I received was unlined, branded with CLC, and made in China. If you are okay with the all inconsistencies then they would probably be fine. I wanted the Servus because I know it is quality. I finally wore my old pair out after daily use for the last 2 years. The local farm store did not have my size so I ordered online. These boots got shipped back.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: The smell! Yikes!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a chemical sensitivity or if you don't have a porch or garage where you can leave these, choose another product. I have left these on the patio in the sun and rain for 2 weeks and the overwhelming smell of the material is still just as strong as it was when i opened the box. When i transport these boots in my car to use on muddy expeditions, i have to wrap them in a beach towel and put them in a bag so the smell doesn't give me a headache while I drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Different from photo
customer_reviews.text: Boots shipped did not have the cloth like lining as the advertised photo. They are not as stiff as our prior boots from TSC; shaft falls over at ankle when feet are removed. We have kept the boots, but would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: trixie449

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: Just unpacked them...found that they had a brand name logo that said CLC they had no lining on the inside just plain rubber.. OK pvc...maybe? I was led to believe that I was buying Servus brand. That is not what I received. they may do the job, maybe not, I resent FALSE ADVERTISING. Send me what I ordered I ordered Servus brand boots because they are Made in USA these boots say somewhat unclearly...because of shoddy workmanship..made in China
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if they are durable but they are obviously waterproof. They are extremely uncomfortable. Not true to size and I could have bought better rain boots from Walmart. They are a true waste of money. I’m very disappointed. They hurt my feet after 10 minutes of wearing them around the house. Some things you just can’t buy online.
customer_reviews.author: Mary T.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.....
customer_reviews.text: Actually bought these to complete my Santa outfit......had a custom white furry top-of-boot piece made and these boots topped of the outfit......looked like a complete Santa !!.....On the other hand, these boots would be great if you're looking for rainboots as they are well made, sturdy, and comfortable. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: patrick donley

customer_reviews.title: Half size? Round down
customer_reviews.text: My shoe size is 10.5. Since CLC doesn't offer half sizes I opted to round up, since reviews suggested I do so. DON'T. I bought the 11 and they were way too big. I bought the 10 and surprisingly they are the perfect size, roomy even. Otherwise, the boots are great. Obviously waterproof, but comfy as well. It's just plain rubber in and out, no cushioning so wear socks. Overall, great boots, just be careful with sizing.
customer_reviews.author: RxRoids101

customer_reviews.title: Leaked
customer_reviews.text: We own property with a creek, mud, and lots of trees to clear. These boots were very affordable, but must be more appropriate for someone walking through tall grass instead of standing in puddles/mud/a creek. We returned them and got rubber boots instead
customer_reviews.author: Laura Salerno

customer_reviews.title: Feet dry and comfy.
customer_reviews.text: The boots were specifically purchased to wear at the US Gran Pric in case it rained, again. It poured. And the parking lot was a quagmire. Shoes might have been ruined but the boots slogged through the mud both in the parking lot and in areas around the track. I’ve used them many times since then because of the very wet Fall and Winter this year (2018/2019). All good. They fit well, the size wad about right. I’ve worn them bare foot a couple of times and I can safely say that they are sized fior heavy cotton socks. And not really built with bare feet in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon M. Pyron

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Very cheep boots not sure if they would last more then a few uses. Then there make in China so plan on ordering about 2 sizes larger then you would normaly wear. I orderes a 11 for a 10 1/2 foot and I couldn't get my foot in them. I gave them to my daughter to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Nick K.

customer_reviews.title: received another brand - ordered the size 11 Servus brand but received a CLC brand?
customer_reviews.text: I read that this Servus Boot was a Made in the USA product but received a totally different Boot CLC MADE IN CHINA. I went back to check and noticed the Size 10 was a CLC while the rest are all Servus brand including the size 11 which I ordered. The Product headline is Servus so they should not be mixing.
customer_reviews.author: CrisKatHawaii

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: Different size = ENTIRELY different boot
customer_reviews.text: Beware: size 14 and size 13 are not the same boot. I bought the size 14 but it was too big. I am a size 13 and went up a size given the reviews. I exchanged the size 14 boots and ordered the size 13 - but it’s an ENTIRELY different boot from the size 14. The size 13 has a yellow logo on the front which is not ok and overall it looks lower quality. I actually prefer the style, tread and feel of the size 14 over the size 13. Just be careful, they switch boots on you based upon the size.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon A. Sims

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: Good boots. Exactly as advertised. Size 10 fits well and as expected (shoe size I’m usually a 9.5W or 10). Gave it a 4 stars instead of 5 because you can see by the photo how the top of 1 boot has wear and tear already from how it came. Came in a plastic bag shipped by amazon - not in an original box. Hoping these bode well and dry for pressure washing. For $21 and free shipping these are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: They laughed, until the storm hit
customer_reviews.text: The boots are good. Insoles are definitely needed because there is no cushions at all. I'm a size 13 and I ordered a size 13 but I should have bought a size larger because my toes kinda crammed in there and even less room with a insole. The people at work laughed when they saw me show up with these on one sunny day and several hours into the day, it began to storm and flood everything. I laughed as I stomped through the enormous puddles. Hahahaa
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: A bit big for me
customer_reviews.text: These are well made and durable rubber boots. My foot falls in the half size category and for me, ordering a size smaller would have been the better option than the size up. While I have muscular legs, the tops of the boots have too much room in them and when power washing, I got water in them.......enough to pour out of the boot. Too late to return to Amazon for a smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick. Yep.
customer_reviews.text: No liner or felt whatsoever. All rubber. But the opening is wide enough to easily slip foot in. Insole is well shaped and feels comfortable. Sole has good heel and tread lugs. If they last, they’ll be a good purchase. I’m happy, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Poopser

customer_reviews.title: Good functionality for a low price
customer_reviews.text: These are very good boots especially considering the low price. Well made handmade in USA. Better insole support than I would expect. Bit heavier than I would like but to be expected for allow priced boot. Very good soles & treads. Loose in the calves for a comfortable fit. I found the fit of the shoe portion to be about 1//2 size too large; good if I am wearing heavy socks, not so good for quick use without socks. Liked them so much Immediately bought another pair as a gift for someone.
customer_reviews.author: Cheff Jeff

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: NOT INCLUDED AS ADVERTISED " Lightweight FOOT FORM contour cushion insole provides arch and heel support, and is removable, washable and replaceable" NO INSOLE AT ALL< JUST RUBBER BOTTOM OF RUBBER BOOT
customer_reviews.author: Jo Derk

customer_reviews.title: Run true to size
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a mans 8 (I wear woman 9) not sure how these shoes run. They rune true to size. On the bottom of my mans 8 there is a "woman 10" beside it. Not this is great if you plan on wearing thick socks. I ordered mine to just take the dog out and work in the garden. So the size difference won't matter to me. But if you plan on traveling or walking a lot in them you might want to go with your true size.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Not Servus!! False advertising
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, I was sent the CLC boot instead of Servus. I specifically chose Servus for the fabric lining, insole, scalloped edge, and made in USA. This CLC boot is made in China, is floppy, no lining or insole, and oversized. They are going back.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: For outdoor activities or on rainy days at the office these boots can keep those tootsies nice and warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: Still have these bought about 5 years ago. I don't wear w shoes. Made w high quality rubber that has held up for the long haul. For outdoor activities or on rainy days at the office these boots can keep those tootsies nice and warm and dry. A couple of days like that and these boots have paid for themselves in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: chris2011

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I use these to fish. You’re not going to find a better product at this price. I slipped in a pair of thick inner soles and they fit perfectly with 2 pairs of socks. I ordered my usual size. I am a size 10 in womenswear, so I ordered the size 8 in men’s size, they fit perfectly. I use these for surf fishing and my feet stay warm and dry. I would most definitely recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for my husband
customer_reviews.text: Purchase these boots for my husband because we do a lot of outside yard work and I'm tired of him getting his shoes muddy all the time so I got him these boots and he absolutely loves how easily they slipped on and off. just to let customers know these boots are very flimsy at the bottom there not a hardcore surface so it kind of feels like you're barefoot when you're wearing them
customer_reviews.author: airforce

customer_reviews.title: Cancer warning and strong chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: The tag attached to the boots has a cancer warning. Wonder why that's not part of the product description (not hard to guess) When I go to the web link given, it's not much help other than there's something nasty in the boots. The strong chemical smell is enough by itself for me to return them, which I will. Amazon, why do you allow the sale of this product?
customer_reviews.author: MZ

customer_reviews.title: Too tight on avg sized calves and strong off gassing odor
customer_reviews.text: These CLC Custom Leathercraft rain boots for men had an opening that was too small. It was hard to get my foot in and it was too tight around my average sized calves. It also had a very strong off gassing odor. It made the room smell like someone spilled oil. It’s a good thing Jesé boots were “sold and shipped” by Amazon because Amazon has a very good return policy.
customer_reviews.author: wavesur4

customer_reviews.title: Sore feet a coming.
customer_reviews.text: Not tru to size. Smaller than expected. No foot bed. Very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: BlackCrocTN

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof boot with good traction on the sole.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to cross a shallow creek. Had water up to the rings at the top of the boot and no leaks. The sole provided plenty of traction for walking uphill on a muddy dirt road. For the price, you cant beat this boot. A word of advice, these seem to run a bit large. If you normally wear a half size, step DOWN rather than up. I did the opposite and had a bit too much extra room.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Well made rain boot
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my boyfriend to walk the dogs in. We go to different parks and in the spring sneakers are impossible. He likes this boot, its durable, not too heavy and he says its comfy enough for a rain boot. He did say he wished it went higher up his calf but they do the job. No cracks yet and he has walked at least 10-15 miles in them since getting them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These boots aren't made for walking
customer_reviews.text: I have now had two pairs of these. The first pair lasted a month, the second pair 3 weeks. They both got a hole in the right boot on the side in the same place. I am a lawn care technician, so I walk a lot. These may be good for occasional wear, but will not last long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price for good product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these boots for power-washing decks, etc. They arrived as suggested, the fit is perfect to his shoe size, the quality is good rubber to match the needs for the kind of work to be done. Will order these again when they need replacing in a few years. Very happy and satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: clarice

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The boots I received were not as advertised. There was no liner (I specifically chose this pair because of the advertised liner) & they are clearly marked “made in China.” It would appear from reading other reviews that I received a very different pair of boots than others did. Will be returning. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: wsdoin

customer_reviews.title: Boot Splits
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months of very Lite use, the back of the right boot got a 3 inch split in it. The boots were used about a hour a day around the farm to feed animals ,and to keep your feet dry when when adding or replacing water in the stock tanks. I would not recommend buying them because they don't seem to last. The warranty they have is you have to pay for return shipping, which would cost you almost as much as the original cost of the boots.
customer_reviews.author: Canyon

customer_reviews.title: Rain Boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband for Christmas. He is particular about foot wear. He loves these boots. Water proof and comfortable. He wears them all day long and says that they are very comfortable. We are outside a lot cutting wood, hiking, etc. all seasons for the year.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Not The Servus Boots I Ordered. Had to Pay for Return Shipping
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the Servus boots like many others and received an entirely different boot and different brand (CLC instead of Servus). In addition, I had to pay for return shipping and there is no way to contact them in hopes they would take care of the situation. Pay attention to the picture that comes up when you click your size because it will change to the CLC boot on some random sizes even though the title is still for the Servus.
customer_reviews.author: Casidy Marks

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: these boots are okay and for the price are decent. i would not recommend them for hiking or walking on rough terrain because you feel everything through the soles which have no cushioning. Your feet will get cold real fast and the rubber ripped easily when putting my foot into them so not that durable. for the price they do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Denali

customer_reviews.title: No insole as described, which makes them fit way too big (even after ordering a size small)
customer_reviews.text: The boots were supposed to come with soft insoles, but there were none. The boots also wreak of chemical smell, which I could get over if they actually came as described. I wish there were a way to ask for the insoles to be sent without returning the boots, but this is impossible, so they are getting a bad review instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN CHINA, not Made in the USA. False advertising.
customer_reviews.text: We bought 4 of these directly from Amazon, not from a third-party reseller. They all say Made In China. The claim that they are Made in the USA is false advertising. They feel lightweight and low-quality. I wouldn't pay half the price they are asking for.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Bait and Switch scam!!!
customer_reviews.text: Did NOT receive Servus brand boots, instead got CRC brand, which I've never heard of! A scam!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Perry

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and even better price
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was looking for a cheap boot to get dirty and hose off if needed. Treat like trash. But these boots have held up in mud, branches, grass, etc. Hard yard work. Super happy with the way these are and if I ever need another pair i'm getting another set of these!
customer_reviews.author: Jon Tuazon

customer_reviews.title: Mud Boots
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my husband for the extremely rainy winter we've been having. They're comfortable enough that he does wear them often for doing things outside in the mud. Well-made, easy-to-wash, basic rain/mud boots.
customer_reviews.author: BF

customer_reviews.title: Serious boots - thick and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Ok, these are serious water boots. VERY heavy and VERY thick. Had I known they were this solid I would have purchased something a little less quality, as I got them for my husband to wear when he goes fishing in the bay. These boots will last him a lifetime. He did say they wore blisters on his toes - so now he wears socks with them and all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Having just received them I cannot speak to longevity or durability. What I can speak to is sizing. I have a 9.5 EEE mens US foot size. After reading the somewhat contradicting sizing reviews I went with a size 8. It was the right move. They fit great with one pair of thick socks.
customer_reviews.author: Pal Al

customer_reviews.title: Not the right size for me.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 8.5 size shoe. I bought a size 8, thinking the boot might be a little small. It turns out that they are way to big. It feels like I need to to use them with street shoes on. Then maybe I could walk around without falling down.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: New boots and dry feet
customer_reviews.text: Husband super pleased. Due to recent rain and rain and rain, we have water front property. Could not get to our cars or the work shop. Thank goodness he has new boots that fit well and keep his feet dry.
customer_reviews.author: William E.

customer_reviews.title: REALLY BIG
customer_reviews.text: These will definitely do the job keeping my feet dry in the mud out at the ranch. But wow, they are REALLY big. I would recommend getting at least one size small or wearing two pair of socks. Nonetheless, they do serve their purpose.
customer_reviews.author: richm

customer_reviews.title: Boots Do Not Stand Upright
customer_reviews.text: The rubber is not stiff, therefore, you can’t just slip your foot into them, like with other rubber boots that stand upright. These just slump into the ground. Very misleading, because in the ad, it shows them standing up, like most rubber boots! You have to bend over every time to pick up the top of the boot. Very impractical.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Newsome

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for me.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great, We breed dogs and I needed these to keep my feet clean in the pens. They seem sturdy, of good quality, and feel comfortable. I would recommend these to other people needing boots for similar purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Seems Good
customer_reviews.text: Got them today. Tried them on, seems like I ordered the right size (size 11 my usual size), I don't think I'd want them any smaller...especially since I plan on wearing more than one pair of socks and I plan on putting in an insole in them. I bought them for clam digging on the coast, which opens next week. The PVC is thinker than I anticipated, so they should be durable. I think they should have included an insole, I bought the same pair for my son only in size 8, and those came with an insole. I'll update this if thinks change after wearing them for hours on the beach.
customer_reviews.author: LN Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Good boot, bad sizing
customer_reviews.text: Boots seem to be rugged and of good quality. Low star rating due to sizing is off - way off. The boots were at least several sizes larger than the stated size. They were still loose fitting even after putting on sneakers and pulling boot on over my shoes. The ad seemed to indicate these boots were true to size, not worn over shoes ...
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Sized too large
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with the size. I am usually a 9.5 but went with a half size up since they are only offered in whole sizes. Size 10 were way too large so I went with a 9 and they are still a full size too large. The crazy thing is... I have a similar pair of Servus boots but more expensive, chemical resistant, ..... they are a size 10 and a snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: ECHO444

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband to do yard work in our muddy yard. He wears a size 11. I purchased an 11, and he says they are large but not too large. They are a little stiff/hard—not particularly comfortable. But he still likes them and wants to keep them mainly because he likes the price and they are exactly what he needs for the muddy yard.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was fast. This boot is well made. Rubber is heavy, but soft around upper leg rim. 1st boots ordered was size 11...fit like a 12 1/2. 2nd boot was ordered as size 10...fits like a 11. I will wear thicker sock. These should work for what I want them for. Made in the USA!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: LAS

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is a little off
customer_reviews.text: My son wears a 10 normally, I got him these boots, he complains of them being too small. Returning for a larger size. They seem quite durable and the quality seems to be on point.
customer_reviews.author: HolidayCheer

customer_reviews.title: I'll never but these again...
customer_reviews.text: Awful smell, and ran very large for size. Returned them immediately.
customer_reviews.author: N. S. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Keeping the feet dry!!
customer_reviews.text: We had a huge rainstorm the other day. My husband wore his boots and stayed dry. The boots were a little larger than expected, but that allowed him to wear an extra pair of socks.
customer_reviews.author: Connie P

customer_reviews.title: MUCKOUT Boots
customer_reviews.text: Good price and timely delivery but these are very hard inside soles which make for uncomfortable walking while wearing them. Guess these will be for wintertime use only when I can wear extra thick work socks. Arrrgghh.
customer_reviews.author: Torqwrench

customer_reviews.title: Take two highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing which is a rare thing with these for the boots but this particular model can easily be a size higher or size lower is it got very good traction I wore it and 2.5 feet of water and it was fine
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Valley

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for wearing into my chicken pen, which is horrible when it rains. These are perfect. Easy to slip on, and great traction with no slipping in the mud!
customer_reviews.author: Bothump

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 7 1/2. I ordered the size 8 and figured they would be loose and I'd have to wear a couple pair of thick socks to get a comfortable fit. These were actually comfortable with just one pair of socks and my feet don't slide around like I thought they would.
customer_reviews.author: Norm E.

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATER PROOF
customer_reviews.text: I wore my boots three times around the yard in muddy situations - worked fine. Once I stepped into a creek I had water seeping in through the soles and heal - NOT WORTH IT! I can't return them now - but I would if I could!
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 17 years old son and he likes it for water proof and comfort when he works the yard. Great price point, fitting guide lines is accurate . As far as durability only times will tell because any footwear will break at some point but it’s perfect right now.
customer_reviews.author: aby

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my husband to work in yards and he said it was very comfortable. It does it’s job! Wear it for several times during lawn care and no complains so far.
customer_reviews.author: hollya

customer_reviews.title: These boots don't fit
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman and my feet could not fit these boots. I bought them because my basement flooded and we needed them badly. I tried to put them on and I couldn't get it on at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Severe weather left me high and dry.
customer_reviews.text: I used these boots to survive severe California winter storms this winter. They kept me dry during the "atmospheric rivers" we've been experiencing (as much rain as a strong Hawaiian konah storm). They're also good for slogging through muddy trails.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ditmore

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Nice well made boots. Wish I bought these years ago. Comfortable and seem like they will be durable. Lleft them outdoors for a few days and the smell of the unreacted monomers is gone. Ignore the comments about cancer unless you plan to eat your boots. I am certain that my car tires and many batteries cause cancer too. Just dispose of them properly when they need to go.
customer_reviews.author: E. Pluribus Unum

customer_reviews.title: Even held up to climbing a tree.
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old son would wear these boots everywhere if I would let him. He has sensory issues and cannot stand most shoes. He loves that they work well in the orchard and he even climbed a tree in them to save a kitten one day. Although there is an obvious seam running down the middle of the boots, clearly visible if you're looking at them head on, the boot is still very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Norcalchica

customer_reviews.title: Just What Was Expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my boyfriend's son and he said that they are just what he wanted. He loves to go out into the wilderness to fish and enjoy nature here in Florida.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Watson

customer_reviews.title: They run a little large, so order a size smaller than normal.
customer_reviews.text: These ran a little large and I had to exchange them for a size smaller than what I typically wear. I bought them to use with a Tyvek suit for removing toxic bottom paint from boats and they do what I need them to.
customer_reviews.author: RiskEverything

customer_reviews.title: Use the sizing chart!
customer_reviews.text: Great boot, but it definitely runs LARGE! My son wears a size 8 shoe, but the size 8 is way too big for his foot. Be sure to use the sizing chart when ordering.
customer_reviews.author: GLB

customer_reviews.title: Decent boots
customer_reviews.text: Good value boots. Don't leak. I don't wear all day so comfortable enough. You probably would want Dr. Scholl or similar insoles if you wore all day. Easy to get on/off.
customer_reviews.author: Frank W. Cranmer

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: I like the comfort and fit. I cannot see any weak areas that could be prone to tear over time like my old boots. Hoping for many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: D.S.

customer_reviews.title: be aware of size
customer_reviews.text: overall product looks ok however the size is way too big than what it says. you may want to get a size smaller than what you normally wear
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Waston

customer_reviews.title: On time and as described
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy rubber boot. They do run a bit big but I am ok with that. They will be a bit big in the summer but in the spring and fall when I will be wearing a heavier sock these will be just right. I did add an insole because it is just a hard rubber sole. They arrive on time and in good condition too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris from EA

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and are easy on and off
customer_reviews.text: Where I live if the weather is bad the ground gets very muddy and these have been just what I needed. Now I don't have to worry about ruining a pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Haverkorn

customer_reviews.title: ... were way too big but the boot itself was good quality and made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a size 12 first time and they were way too big but the boot itself was good quality and made in USA! I returned them and ordered a size 11 Although the 11's were a better fit, these SMELLED OF RUBBER something terrible and they were made in CHINA. Quality is inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor of  Wellness

customer_reviews.title: Not the most comfortable rain boots out there but they do what they’re ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the most comfortable rain boots out there but they do what they’re meant for. I bought these for hurricane season and luckily I didn’t have to tread through and flood waters, just major puddles. Walking around in these was a bit harsh on my feet and they need to be broken in a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Killian

customer_reviews.title: made very well
customer_reviews.text: I was so pleased with the quality of these boots. They were for my husband and he can't wait to do some clamming wearing these boots!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought half size smaller and was perfect fit (wears 10.5 bought 10) Husband liked the fit and they were perfect for working out in a field. Good height. A bit heavy for me though....
customer_reviews.author: RT Mom

customer_reviews.title: great farm chore boots
customer_reviews.text: love these boots. I wear them year round for horse chores. Easy on and off and boots are not heavy like the Servis brand. I have 3 pair I rotate each time I go in and out so they can breathe and dry out. Some are safety toe and some not. hard to tell
customer_reviews.author: chosen by horses

customer_reviews.title: Boots didnt Last - BURST AT THE SEAMS
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these boots for one of our guys to try out in our granite fabrication shop and it didn't last two months. They get used at least 40 hours a week in constant wet environment so they get abused but usually the boots we buy last almost a year before we see any holes or tears on the seams of the boots. Based on our experience I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Slisboa

customer_reviews.title: Nice durable boots
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I got them for my 8 year old as he hasn't bad a proper pair of rain boots in years. Durable and comfortable. They seem to run a bit small; I ordered a size up and they fit well but are just a tad snug. No big deal, but I am glad I ordered a bit bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy boots. Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Boots are sturdy and should last a long time. Top is wide enough for jeans to fit into them. Fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri B

customer_reviews.title: Made in China, not USA.
customer_reviews.text: Got these today so I have not even worn them yet. I can’t say anything about the quality, but I’m pissed! It clearly states in the description; Made in the USA. These are made in China. Outright liars!
customer_reviews.author: Lisbeth Holm

customer_reviews.title: Huge!
customer_reviews.text: These are huge. I ordered smaller than normal and I could almost fit my other foot in it as well
customer_reviews.author: Evan Mohn

customer_reviews.title: Just in Time
customer_reviews.text: Bad weather came and the boots are great for rain or snow. Thank you for a good product and swift shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Martin

customer_reviews.title: punctured and leaked right away
customer_reviews.text: Very soft rubber which quickly punctured and leaked in multiple places after light use on a beach in very light brush
customer_reviews.author: Matt Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Not Honeywell Product
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why this get listed under Honeywell but it’s not a Honeywell product. Made in China with an unheard company name.
customer_reviews.author: Zhaoqi P.

product_meta.title: CLC Custom Leathercraft Rain Wear R230 Over The Sock Black PVC Men's Rain Boot, Size 11
product_meta.description:
Size:11These standard black PVC rain boots have a durable cleated sole for improved traction and are sized to be worn with your thick socks.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
CLC has been the industry standard for over 30 years through an unrivaled dedication to innovation, craftmanship, and quality.
feature_bullets: SNEAKER-LIKE COMFORT: EVA FOOT FORM provides sneaker-like comfort for all-day wear in these CLC rain boots.
IMPROVED TRACTION: Cleated sole on these rain boots allow for improved traction.
SCALLOPED DESIGN: These rain boots feature a scalloped top-line design to accommodate flexing in the calf area to reduce irritation.
DURABLE RAIN BOOT: These rain boots are made with durable PVC material.
Boots may come with/Without the logo as it is a running change, Item is the same.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,379 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
